"If you'd been there, you would've run from that deer, too!"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

card.name: Personal Tutor
card.ability: Search your library for a sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Phantasmal Fiend
card.ability:
{B}: Phantasmal Fiend gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
{1}{U}: Switch Phantasmal Fiend's power and toughness until end of turn.
card.ruling:
11/1/2005 : Note that the wording "Effects that alter the creature's power alter its toughness instead, and vice versa, this turn" has been removed.
10/1/2008 : Effects that switch power and toughness are always applied last when determining a creature's power and toughness, even if other power/toughness-changing effects are created later in the turn. For example, if you activate Phantasmal Fiend's first ability, it will become 2/4. Then if you activate its second ability, it will become 4/2. Then if you activate its first ability again, it will become 3/3.
4/15/2013 : Effects that switch power and toughness apply after all other effects that change power and/or toughness, regardless of which effect was created first.
4/15/2013 : Switching a creature’s power and toughness twice (or any even number of times) effectively returns the creature to the power and toughness it had before any switches.

card.name: Phantasmal Mount
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Target creature you control with toughness 2 or less gets +1/+1 and gains flying until end of turn. When Phantasmal Mount leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice that creature. When the creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Phantasmal Mount.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : If the ability resolves, then the targeted creature's toughness becomes greater than 2 later, Phantasmal Mount's effect will not end. (The ability checks whether the creature has toughness 2 or less only at the time you activate it and the time it resolves.)

card.name: Phyrexian Devourer
card.ability:
When Phyrexian Devourer's power is 7 or greater, sacrifice it.
Exile the top card of your library: Put X +1/+1 counters on Phyrexian Devourer, where X is the exiled card's converted mana cost.
card.ruling: 9/22/2011 : Phyrexian Devourer's first ability continually checks its power as a state trigger. Once it triggers, it won't trigger again as long as the ability is on the stack. If the ability is countered and the trigger condition is still true, it will immediately trigger again. If the ability resolves, you'll have to sacrifice Phyrexian Devourer even if its power has been reduced to 6 or less by then.

card.name: Phyrexian Portal
card.ability: {3}: If your library has ten or more cards in it, target opponent looks at the top ten cards of your library and separates them into two face-down piles. Exile one of those piles. Search the other pile for a card, put it into your hand, then shuffle the rest of that pile into your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The two piles don't have to have the same number of cards in them. One of the piles may have zero cards.

card.name: Pillage
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"Were they to reduce us to ash, we would clog their throats and sting their eyes in payment."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

card.name: Portent
card.ability:
Look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order. You may have that player shuffle his or her library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This does not cause a player to lose if they have less than 3 cards in their library. It allows you to look at and reorder or shuffle whatever remaining cards there might be.

card.name: Pyrokinesis
card.ability:
You may exile a red card from your hand rather than pay Pyrokinesis's mana cost.
Pyrokinesis deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.
card.flavor:
"Anybody want some . . . toast?"
—Jaya Ballard, task mage
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can't do fractional points of damage.
10/1/2008 : The number of targets must be at least 1 and at most 4. You divide the damage as you cast Pyrokinesis, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

card.name: Ravages of War
card.ability: Destroy all lands.
card.flavor:
"Thorn bushes spring up wherever the army has passed. Lean years follow in the wake of a great war."
—Lao Tzu, Tao Te Ching, trans. Feng and English

card.name: Ray of Command
card.ability: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the creature, tap it.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You may target an untapped creature with Ray of Command.
10/4/2004 : The creature returns to the opponent when the "until end of turn" effect wears off during the cleanup step. It taps during the Cleanup step (if it is not already tapped), so any abilities triggered off it tapping happen at that time.
10/1/2008 : You tap the creature when you lose control of it for any reason -- because Ray of Command's effect ends, or because a spell or ability causes another player to gain control of it.

card.name: Red Cliffs Armada
card.ability: Red Cliffs Armada can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
card.flavor: By the battle of Red Cliffs in the year 208, the Wu kingdom controlled more than seven thousand warships on the Yangtze.

card.name: Reinforcements
card.ability: Put up to three target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
card.flavor:
"Let them send their legions! I will show them that my truth is stronger than their swords."
—General Varchild
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You have to show which creature cards you put on top of your library, but not the order you put them there.

card.name: Reprisal
card.ability: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"The meek shall fight as one, and they shall overcome even the greatest of foes."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran priest

card.name: Retribution
card.ability: Choose two target creatures an opponent controls. That player chooses and sacrifices one of those creatures. Put a -1/-1 counter on the other.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : The player chooses which one to sacrifice as Retribution resolves. If only one of the targets is still legal at that time, then the player must choose that one to sacrifice.

card.name: Righteous Fury
card.ability: Destroy all tapped creatures. You gain 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.

card.name: Ritual of Subdual
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
If a land is tapped for mana, it produces colorless mana instead of any other type.
card.flavor:
"That which does not bend to the will of Freyalise shall surely break."
—Kolbjörn, elder druid of the Juniper Order
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : This effect changes the type of mana produced, but not the amount. For example, if a land that's tapped for mana would add {W}{W} to its controller's mana pool, it adds {2} to that player's mana pool instead.

card.name: Ritual of the Machine
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Ritual of the Machine, sacrifice a creature.
Gain control of target nonartifact, nonblack creature.
card.flavor:
"Rumors persist of dark deeds performed in the depths of Soldev. When will Dagsson heed the danger therein?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
4/15/2013 : Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

card.name: Rogue Skycaptain
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a wage counter on Rogue Skycaptain. You may pay {2} for each wage counter on it. If you don't, remove all wage counters from Rogue Skycaptain and an opponent gains control of it.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : No choices are made when this ability triggers. After the wage counter is put on Rogue Skycaptain, then you choose whether to pay mana and, if you don't, which opponent gains control of it.
10/1/2008 : If you can't pay the entire payment, none of it is paid.

card.name: Roterothopter
card.ability:
Flying
{2}: Roterothopter gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
card.flavor:
"The roterothoper is as insidious as it is ingenious. It is one of the few creations of our school that I take no pride in."
—Baki, wizard attendant

card.name: Royal Decree
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {W} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Whenever a Swamp, Mountain, black permanent, or red permanent becomes tapped, Royal Decree deals 1 damage to that permanent's controller.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Royal Decree's ability will trigger a maximum of once for each permanent that becomes tapped, even if that permanent meets multiple criteria. (For example, Badlands is both a Swamp and a Mountain.)

card.name: Royal Trooper
card.ability: Whenever Royal Trooper blocks, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Fortune does not side with the fainthearted."
—Sophocles, Phaedra

card.name: Ruins of Trokair
card.ability:
Ruins of Trokair enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Ruins of Trokair: Add {W}{W} to your mana pool.

card.name: Sacred Boon
card.ability: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. At the beginning of the next end step, put a +0/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.
card.flavor:
"Divine gifts are granted to those who are worthy."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

card.name: Savannah
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
10/1/2008 : This has basic land types, but it isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

card.name: Scars of the Veteran
card.ability:
You may exile a white card from your hand rather than pay Scars of the Veteran's mana cost.
Prevent the next 7 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. At the beginning of the next end step, put a +0/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.

card.name: Screeching Drake
card.ability:
Flying
When Screeching Drake enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.

card.name: Sea Drake
card.ability:
Flying
When Sea Drake enters the battlefield, return two target lands you control to their owner's hand.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : When the ability resolves, if one of the lands has become an illegal target (because it's no longer on the battlefield, for example), you return the other one to your hand. If both of the lands have become illegal targets, the ability is countered. This has no effect on Sea Drake.

card.name: Sea Spirit
card.ability: {U}: Sea Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"It rose above our heads, above the ship, and still higher yet. No foggy, ice-laden sea in the world could frighten me more."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

card.name: Shield Bearer
card.ability: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
card.flavor:
"You have almost completed your four years, my son. Soon you shall be a skyknight."
—Arna Kennerüd, skyknight
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
10/1/2008 : A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
10/1/2008 : Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
10/1/2009 : If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

card.name: Shrink
card.ability: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Do not fear adversity. Let your courage be your strength."
—Onatah, Anaba shaman

card.name: Shyft
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have Shyft become the color or colors of your choice. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.flavor:
"Capturing this specimen was not easy. Study it well, that you someday might be as versatile."
—Gerda Äagesdotter, Archmage of the Unseen
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : Shyft's ability won't let you make it colorless. Colorless is not a color.
10/1/2008 : The ability's effect has no duration. Shyft will remain the chosen color or colors until the game ends, it leaves the battlefield, or some other effect (such as the next time its ability resolves) changes its colors.

card.name: Sibilant Spirit
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Sibilant Spirit attacks, defending player may draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Relax. I'm sure it's just a snake hissing."
—Avram Garrisson, leader of the Knights of Stromgald
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Your opponent does not have to draw a card if they don't want to.

card.name: Skeleton Ship
card.ability:
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Skeleton Ship.
{T}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.
card.flavor:
"The sea gives up her dead as easily as the soil."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

card.name: Skull Catapult
card.ability: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Skull Catapult deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"Let any who doubt the evil of using the ancient devices look at this infernal machine. What manner of fiend would design such a sadistic device?"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

card.name: Snow Fortress
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}: Snow Fortress gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{1}: Snow Fortress gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
{3}: Snow Fortress deals 1 damage to target creature without flying that's attacking you.

card.name: Snow-Covered Forest
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : "Snow" has no particular meaning or rules associated with it.
10/1/2008 : Since this is a basic land, you may have any number of it in a Constructed deck in any format in which the _Masters Edition II_ set, the _Coldsnap_  set, or the _Ice Age_ set is legal.
10/1/2008 : In Limited events, you can't add basic snow lands to your deck from outside your card pool. You may add only lands named Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest, as normal.
10/1/2008 : Effects that target nonbasic lands can't target basic snow lands.

card.name: Snow-Covered Island
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : "Snow" has no particular meaning or rules associated with it.
10/1/2008 : Since this is a basic land, you may have any number of it in a Constructed deck in any format in which the _Masters Edition II_ set, the _Coldsnap_  set, or the _Ice Age_ set is legal.
10/1/2008 : In Limited events, you can't add basic snow lands to your deck from outside your card pool. You may add only lands named Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest, as normal.
10/1/2008 : Effects that target nonbasic lands can't target basic snow lands.

card.name: Snow-Covered Mountain
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : "Snow" has no particular meaning or rules associated with it.
10/1/2008 : Since this is a basic land, you may have any number of it in a Constructed deck in any format in which the _Masters Edition II_ set, the _Coldsnap_  set, or the _Ice Age_ set is legal.
10/1/2008 : In Limited events, you can't add basic snow lands to your deck from outside your card pool. You may add only lands named Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest, as normal.
10/1/2008 : Effects that target nonbasic lands can't target basic snow lands.

card.name: Snow-Covered Plains
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : "Snow" has no particular meaning or rules associated with it.
10/1/2008 : Since this is a basic land, you may have any number of it in a Constructed deck in any format in which the _Masters Edition II_ set, the _Coldsnap_  set, or the _Ice Age_ set is legal.
10/1/2008 : In Limited events, you can't add basic snow lands to your deck from outside your card pool. You may add only lands named Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest, as normal.
10/1/2008 : Effects that target nonbasic lands can't target basic snow lands.

card.name: Snow-Covered Swamp
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : "Snow" has no particular meaning or rules associated with it.
10/1/2008 : Since this is a basic land, you may have any number of it in a Constructed deck in any format in which the _Masters Edition II_ set, the _Coldsnap_  set, or the _Ice Age_ set is legal.
10/1/2008 : In Limited events, you can't add basic snow lands to your deck from outside your card pool. You may add only lands named Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest, as normal.
10/1/2008 : Effects that target nonbasic lands can't target basic snow lands.

card.name: Soldevi Digger
card.ability: {2}: Put the top card of your graveyard on the bottom of your library.
card.flavor:
"This ceaseless device has helped uncover marvels unreachable by mere flesh."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist

card.name: Soldevi Excavations
card.ability:
If Soldevi Excavations would enter the battlefield, sacrifice an untapped Island instead. If you do, put Soldevi Excavations onto the battlefield. If you don't, put it into its owner's graveyard.
{T}: Add {1}{U} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This card produces two different types of mana. If an effect that adds one mana to your mana pool of the same type as the mana produced by this card, you choose which of the two types it produces.

card.name: Soldevi Simulacrum
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{1}: Soldevi Simulacrum gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: They look human—until they bleed.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Paying cumulative upkeep is always optional. If it's not paid, the permanent with cumulative upkeep is sacrificed. Partial payments of the total cumulative upkeep cost can't be made. For example, if a permanent with "cumulative upkeep {1}" has three age counters on it when its cumulative upkeep ability triggers, it gets another age counter and then its controller chooses to either pay {4} or sacrifice the permanent.

card.name: Songs of the Damned
card.ability: Add {B} to your mana pool for each creature card in your graveyard.
card.flavor: Not wind, but the breath of the dead.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Soul Exchange
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Soul Exchange, exile a creature you control.
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Put a +2/+2 counter on that creature if the exiled creature was a Thrull.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Putting a counter on the creature put onto the battlefield is not a targeted effect and so Protection from Black will not prevent it.
10/4/2004 : You exile exactly one creature. You can't exile more than one in an attempt to get a larger effect.
4/1/2008 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Soul Kiss
card.ability:
Enchant creature
{B}, Pay 1 life: Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than three times each turn.

card.name: Spore Cloud
card.ability: Tap all blocking creatures. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. Each attacking creature and each blocking creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Only makes attackers or blockers that have been declared before the spell is cast unable to untap as normal next turn. So, if used before attackers or blockers are declared, it is simply a Fog-like effect. If used after attackers are declared but before blockers are declared, it does the Fog effect and makes attackers not untap as normal. If done after blockers are declared, it has full effect.
10/1/2008 : If a creature affected by Spore Cloud is untapped at the time its controller's next untap step begins, the "doesn't untap" effect doesn't do anything. It won't apply at some later time when that creature is tapped.
10/1/2008 : Spore Cloud doesn't track the creatures' controllers. If an affected creature changes controllers before its old controller's next untap step, Spore Cloud will prevent it from being untapped during its new controller's next untap step.

card.name: Spore Flower
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Spore Flower.
Remove three spore counters from Spore Flower: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

card.name: Stampede
card.ability: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 and gain trample until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"We could see the horizon blacken with the great beasts, but it was too late. The icefield offered no immediate safety, but luckily most of us reached a crevasse in which we could take cover."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

card.name: Stone Spirit
card.ability: Stone Spirit can't be blocked by creatures with flying.
card.flavor:
"The spirit of the stone is the spirit of strength."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain
card.ruling: 5/1/2007 : Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) can block this because they don’t actually have Flying.

card.name: Stonehands
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Trust in the power of stone. Stone is strong; stone shatters swords; stone breaks bones. Trust in stone."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

card.name: Storm Elemental
card.ability:
Flying
{U}, Exile the top card of your library: Tap target creature with flying.
{U}, Exile the top card of your library: If the exiled card is a snow land, Storm Elemental gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : Even though the two activated abilities have the same cost, they're separate. You choose which one you're activating before you exile the top card of your library (and see what it is).
10/1/2008 : If you activate Storm Elemental's third ability and the exiled card is not a snow land, the ability has no effect.

card.name: Storm Spirit
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Storm Spirit deals 2 damage to target creature.
card.flavor:
"Come to us, with your lightning. Come to us, with your thunder. Serve us with your strength, and smite our foes with your power."
—Steinar Icefist, Balduvian shaman

card.name: Stromgald Cabal
card.ability: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target white spell.
card.flavor:
"Kjeldor must be supreme at any cost."
—Avram Garrisson, leader of the Knights of Stromgald

card.name: Stunted Growth
card.ability: Target player chooses three cards from his or her hand and puts them on top of his or her library in any order.

card.name: Sustaining Spirit
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {1}{W} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
card.flavor:
"Faith is our greatest protector."
—Halvor Arensson, Kjeldoran priest
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Does not affect damage if you are already at zero or negative life. You still take it all.
10/1/2008 : Paying cumulative upkeep is always optional. If it's not paid, the permanent with cumulative upkeep is sacrificed. Partial payments of the total cumulative upkeep cost can't be made. For example, if a permanent with "cumulative upkeep {1}" has three age counters on it when its cumulative upkeep ability triggers, it gets another age counter and then its controller chooses to either pay {4} or sacrifice the permanent.
10/1/2008 : The second ability applies only if your life total is being reduced by damage. Other effects or costs (such as "lose 1 life" or "pay 1 life") can reduce your life total below 1 as normal.
10/1/2008 : If an effect asks you to pay life, you can't pay more life than you have.
10/1/2008 : The second ability is not a prevention effect. It stops unpreventable damage from reducing your life total below 1.
10/1/2008 : The ability doesn't change how much damage is dealt; it just changes how much life that damage makes you lose. An effect such as Spirit Link will see the full amount of damage being dealt.
10/1/2008 : Sustaining Spirit won't prevent you from losing the game if your life total is 0 or less or some other effect causes you to lose the game.

card.name: Svyelunite Temple
card.ability:
Svyelunite Temple enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Svyelunite Temple: Add {U}{U} to your mana pool.

card.name: Swords to Plowshares
card.ability: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.
card.flavor:
"The so-called barbarians will not respect us for our military might—they will respect us for our honor."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, leader of the Order of the White Shield
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the creature has a negative power, the player does not lose life. It acts the same as if it had a power of zero.
10/1/2008 : The amount of life that's gained is equal to the power of the targeted creature as it last existed on the battlefield.

card.name: Taiga
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
10/1/2008 : This has basic land types, but it isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

card.name: Temporal Manipulation
card.ability: Take an extra turn after this one.
card.flavor: Doing something at the last minute isn't so bad when you can make that minute last.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

card.name: Thallid
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thallid.
Remove three spore counters from Thallid: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

card.name: Thallid Devourer
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Thallid Devourer.
Remove three spore counters from Thallid Devourer: Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
Sacrifice a Saproling: Thallid Devourer gets +1/+2 until end of turn.

card.name: Thelonite Druid
card.ability: {1}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Forests you control become 2/3 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.
card.flavor:
"The magic at the heart of all living things can bear awe-inspiring fruit."
—Kolevi of Havenwood, elder druid
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The most recent land animating ability takes precedence.
10/4/2004 : Can sacrifice the Druid to itself.
10/4/2004 : Only affects Forests that are on the battlefield when the effect resolves.
10/4/2004 : The land animation ability does not wear off if the land stops being a Forest. It continues until the end of the turn.
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Thermokarst
card.ability: Destroy target land. If that land was a snow land, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor:
"Finally we understand the lesson of our home: loss begets renewal."
—Kolbjörn, elder druid of the Juniper Order

card.name: Thought Lash
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep—Exile the top card of your library. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When a player doesn't pay Thought Lash's cumulative upkeep, that player exiles all cards from his or her library.
Exile the top card of your library: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you don't pay Thought Lash's cumulative upkeep, you'll sacrifice Thought Lash as normal, then, when its triggered ability resolves, you'll exile all cards in your library.
10/1/2008 : If your library has no cards in it, you can't activate the last ability.

card.name: Thunder Wall
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
{U}: Thunder Wall gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The lemures had barely taken wing when the sky roared with thunder. The swarm of little beasts wavered, divided, and fell, crashing to the earth."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

card.name: Time Bomb
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a time counter on Time Bomb.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Time Bomb: Time Bomb deals damage equal to the number of time counters on it to each creature and each player.

card.name: Tinder Wall
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Sacrifice Tinder Wall: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool.
{R}, Sacrifice Tinder Wall: Tinder Wall deals 2 damage to target creature it's blocking.

card.name: Tundra
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
10/1/2008 : This has basic land types, but it isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

card.name: Underground Sea
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
10/1/2008 : This has basic land types, but it isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

card.name: Varchild's Crusader
card.ability: {0}: Varchild's Crusader can't be blocked this turn except by Walls. Sacrifice Varchild's Crusader at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor:
"Every patch of land must belong to Kjeldor, no matter what the cost!"
—General Varchild

card.name: Viscerid Armor
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{1}{U}: Return Viscerid Armor to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: A fallen viscerid's only tribute is to be worn by a comrade.

card.name: Viscerid Drone
card.ability:
{T}, Sacrifice a creature and a Swamp: Destroy target nonartifact creature. It can't be regenerated.
{T}, Sacrifice a creature and a snow Swamp: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: Not all of Terisiare's flooding was natural . . . .

card.name: Wall of Kelp
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{U}{U}, {T}: Put a 0/1 blue Plant Wall creature token with defender named Kelp onto the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"Ya can eat it or ya can weave it, but ya can't fight in it."
—Zeki, reef pirate

card.name: Warning
card.ability: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target attacking creature this turn.
card.flavor:
"The folk of the Karplusan mountains are impossible to ambush."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

card.name: Whirling Catapult
card.ability: {2}, Exile the top two cards of your library: Whirling Catapult deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player.
card.flavor:
"Direct confrontation never was to the orcs' taste."
—General Varchild
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : If your library has fewer than two cards in it, you can't activate the ability.

card.name: Whiteout
card.ability:
All creatures lose flying until end of turn.
Sacrifice a snow land: Return Whiteout from your graveyard to your hand.

card.name: Wiitigo
card.ability:
Wiitigo enters the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Wiitigo if it has blocked or been blocked since your last upkeep. Otherwise, remove a +1/+1 counter from it.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Any +1/+1 counter from any source can be used with his ability.

card.name: Wind Spirit
card.ability:
Flying
Wind Spirit can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
card.flavor:
"To visit the sky requires bravery, and thought, and little else. To master the sky requires the binding of its masters, and little else."
—Arnjlot Olasson, sky mage

card.name: Wings of Aesthir
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has flying and first strike.
card.flavor:
"For those of courage, even the sky holds no limit."
—Arnjlot Olasson, sky mage

card.name: Winter's Night
card.ability: Whenever a player taps a snow land for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced. That land doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : If a land affected by Winter's Night is untapped at the time its controller's next untap step begins, the "doesn't untap" effect doesn't do anything. It won't apply at some later time when that land is tapped.
10/1/2008 : Winter's Night doesn't track the lands' controllers. If an affected land changes controllers before its old controller's next untap step, Winter's Night will prevent it from being untapped during its new controller's next untap step.
10/1/2008 : This has the supertype world. This supertype is similar to legendary. The difference is that when a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

card.name: Withering Wisps
card.ability:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Withering Wisps.
{B}: Withering Wisps deals 1 damage to each creature and each player. Activate this ability no more times each turn than the number of snow Swamps you control.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : Withering Wisps's triggered ability has an "intervening 'if' clause." That means (1) the ability won't trigger at all unless there are no creatures on the battlefield when a turn's end step begins, and (2) the ability will do nothing if there are any creatures on the battlefield by the time the ability resolves.
10/1/2008 : If all creatures leave the battlefield during a turn's End step (after any "at the beginning of the end step" triggers would have triggered that turn), Withering Wisps will remain on the battlefield because the trigger condition has already passed.
10/1/2008 : The number of snow Swamps you control and the number of times Withering Wisps's ability has been activated so far that turn are checked each time you attempt to activate the ability.

card.name: Wolf Pack
card.ability: You may have Wolf Pack assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.
4/1/2008 : When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
4/1/2008 : You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
4/1/2008 : If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".
